metadata.title: CVE-2022-24810 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
net-snmp provides various tools relating to the Simple Network ManagementProtocol. Prior to version 5.9.2, a user with read-write credentials canuse a malformed OID in a SET to the nsVacmAccessTable to cause a NULLpointer dereference. Version 5.9.2 contains a patch. Users should usestrong SNMPv3 credentials and avoid sharing the credentials. Those who mustuse SNMPv1 or SNMPv2c should use a complex community string and enhance theprotection by restricting access to a given IP address range.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsnmp-base - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6+esm1
libsnmp-perl - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6+esm1
libsnmp30 - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6+esm1
python-netsnmp - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6+esm1
snmp - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6+esm1
snmpd - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6+esm1
snmptrapd - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6+esm1
tkmib - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6+esm1').
